channel.title: dorkbot pittsburgh podcasts
channel.itunes:subtitle: dorkbot pittsburgh podcasts
channel.itunes:author: dorkbot pittsburgh
channel.itunes:summary: podcasts from the monthly dorkbot pittsburgh meeting
channel.description: dorkbot pittsburgh is a local chapter of the international dorkbot movement. When possible, we will record our speakers and make them available in audio or video podcast.

item.description: Artist Keny Marshall discusses his work.

item.title: Jim Jen, AlphaLab, March 2008
item.description: GJim is the Executive in Residence at AlphaLab, a six month program for software startups that provides companies with funding, free office space, services, and access to investors and advisors.

item.itunes:subtitle: Jim Jen, AlphaLab
item.itunes:summary: Jim is the Executive in Residence at AlphaLab, a six month program for software startups that provides companies with funding, free office space, services, and access to investors and advisors.

item.title: Kazuhiro JO, audio/music research and dorkbot tokyo cofounder, January 2007
item.description: Kazuhiro JO shows photos and video from dorkbot tokyo and demonstrates his own research work on the monalisa audio/video project.

item.title: Roger Dannenberg, School of Art and and School of Computer Science, Carnegie Mellon, January 2007
item.description: Roger Dannenberg presents recent work involving computer accompaniment of live musicians, content-based music retrieval, interactive media, and high-level languages for sound synthesis.
item.itunes:author: dorkbot pittsburgh
item.itunes:subtitle: Roger Dannenberg, School of Art and and School of Computer Science, Carnegie Mellon
item.itunes:summary: Roger Dannenberg presents recent work involving computer accompaniment of live musicians, content-based music retrieval, interactive media, and high-level languages for sound synthesis.

item.title: Jacob Ciocci, artist, January 2007
item.description: Jacob Cicocci presents work from Paper Rad, synthesizing pop culture, video games, animation and found video.
item.itunes:author: dorkbot pittsburgh
item.itunes:subtitle: Jacob Ciocci, artist
item.itunes:summary: Jacob Cicocci presents work from Paper Rad, synthesizing pop culture, video games, animation and found video.

item.title: Kevin C. Smith, circuit bender, dorkbot pittsburgh, November 2006
item.description: Kevin C. Smith gives an overview of circuit bending including what to bend and basic techniques.
item.itunes:author: dorkbot pittsburgh
item.itunes:subtitle: Kevin C. Smith, circuit bender
item.itunes:summary: Kevin C. Smith gives an overview of circuit bending including what to bend and basic techniques.

item.itunes:author: dorkbot pittsburgh
item.itunes:subtitle: Garth Zeglin, professional roboticist, dorkbot pittsburgh, November 2006
item.itunes:summary: Garth Zeglin gives a short overview of past projects, then shows current work, presenting both technical and artistic rationales, and a live demo.
item.itunes:keywords: dorkbot, pittsburgh, podcast, garth zeglin, robots

item.itunes:author: dorkbot pittsburgh
item.itunes:subtitle: Herman "Soy Sos" Pearl, Tuff Sound Recording, dorkbot pittsburgh, September 2006
item.itunes:summary: Herman "Soy Sos" Pearl of Tuff Sound Recording talks about his mixing and recording ethics and does a live demo using a Doepfer analog synthesizer.
item.itunes:keywords: dorkbot, pittsburgh, podcast, Herman Pearl, analog music, Doepfer

item.itunes:author: dorkbot pittsburgh
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonny Farringdon, Body Media, dorkbot pittsburgh, September 2006
item.itunes:summary: Jonny Farringdon of Body Media gives an overview of their sensor technology and some of its uses.
item.itunes:keywords: dorkbot, pittsburgh, podcast, body media, everyware

item.title: Wake Up Call
item.itunes:author: dorkbot pittsburgh
item.itunes:subtitle: Alexi Morrissey and Damien Miller speak at dorkbot pittsburgh, July 2006
item.itunes:summary: Alexi Morrissey and Damien Miller give a demonstration of Wake Up Call and discuss its history and future.
item.itunes:keywords: dorkbot, pittsburgh, podcast, wake up call, spoken word

item.title: Dave Mansueto - libsyn.com
item.itunes:author: dorkbot pittsburgh
item.itunes:subtitle: Dave Manseuto speaks at dorkbot pittsburgh, April 2006
item.itunes:summary: The somewhat energetic Dave Mansueto gives a live demonstration of podcasting and talks about his company, libsyn.com.

item.title: Tina "Bean" Blaine - Entertainment Technology Center, Carnegie Mellon
item.itunes:author: dorkbot pittsburgh
item.itunes:subtitle: Tina "Bean" Blaine at dorkbot pittsburgh, April 2006
item.itunes:summary: Tina "Bean" Blaine, previously of D'Cuckoo and Interval and now at Carnegie Mellon's Entertainment Technology Center gives a wide-ranging talk on her work and the work of others in interactive music and gaming.
